alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 8:32AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: .A slow moving front lies east to west across northwest Oregon, roughly from Newport to Corvallis to Detroit. Rain, heavy at times, will continue along and to the north of this front through this evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Oregon, Benton, Clackamas, Linn, Marion, Multnomah, Polk, Tillamook, Washington and Yamhill. In southwest Washington, Clark. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, primarily on small creeks and streams. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
